content:
âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: I think it's nice, at first glance can be solved only by fstring formatting, then you discover the depth of the challenge, and that it's not a "one method call" exercise. +1

Goal
* Please format "s" and "pad" as [[variables]] (in "print s" and in "with the string pad" respectively).

* For clarity, please add:
The padding is formed by adding [[pad]] once or more times as necessary and then truncating it from the right to fit exactly.

Constraints
* Please add "1 â‰¤" before each of the last two constraints.

Cases
* The name of Test 1 is missing.

Thanks.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun puzzle that requires a bit of thinking to cover all cases, but is quite easy to solve once you know the trick.
You can add one more test case for when the pad has to be truncated to fit the desired length. Fun puzzle!

Hi everyone,
I need 3 approvals to validate the related quest. ðŸ˜Š
This is my first contribution â€” thank you very much for your kindness and support !
I like it, 52 bytes golfed, and it's for than just a fstring formating trick, +1
I don't think there's really any need for n to be an int, may as well just make it a string. Cool idea though
Please guys, I need 5 upvotes to validate the quest :-)
You say â€œinteger [[n]],â€ but donâ€™t specify negative numbers. If [[n]] can be negative, does the minus sign count toward length?

Output
* Please change "[length]]" to "[[length]]".

Constraints
* Please mention "[[length]] â‰¥ length of unpadded [[n]]".

Cases
* Please split Test 4 and Validator 4 into two pairs, with a new validator more similar to Test 4 to pair up with Test 4, and a new test more similar to Validator 4 to pair up with Validator 4.

Thanks.
Thank you for your great suggestions :-)

You are right, I've updated with positive integers for both n and length.
Thank you for your com :-)
You'right, i utpdate that. Thank you for the feedback and upvote ;-)

gg dude and don't forget size matters ;-)
thank you for the upvote !

Why do you think it's necessary to add one or more test for last case ? Any example of what you have in mind ?
Thank you for your comment and support :-)
Many thanks

I named every tests and verifivators + updated statement (except "once or more times" since [[pad]] may not be added: I wrote "as many times as necessary").

Thank you one more time for your review, I let you check if my contribution respects the rules and may be aprove it :-)

Thank you so much for your approve and comment :)

1. english is not my native language neither and I followed 5DN1L for the subject so I don't really know what to do given it can be simplify but he thought it needed clarification...

2. constraints state 
length â‰¥ length of unpadded s
to avoid truncating s but it could be something to remove and precise what to do in this case (but it would make rules again more complicated ;-)

If you can get a compromise with 5DN1L i will follow your suggestion :-)

Thanks again
Thanks m'y friend ;-)
Since the clash has already been approved and the proposed new scenario requires additional explanation in the statement, I believe it's best to leave the clash unchanged.

btw me eather eng is not my native lang so that why i said it hard at the first time

about the test case you have al the right to add or not after all its your subject


and thku for your work

I was thinking of something along the lines of

testing
10
abcdefghi

This forces the resultant string to contain only part of the pad. In all of your test cases, the entire pad appears in the final string at least once, even though you do test for truncation in your final test case.

Ok I see, last test added :-)
Thanks
